column4: is there a way to check a windows formatted partition for errors while in ubuntu?
jowi: ntfs
jowi: running xp
jowi: I was resizing my ntfs partition and there was an error. now I can't access the partition at all
jowi: let me see if I have a disk utility available to use as an ntfs program
if you want to edit ntfs partitons (like size etc) use gparted or ntfsprogs
subhuman: do either of those have disk error-corretion programs?
im not sure, it's journalled so why would it get errors?
subhuman: I'm sorry, I don't understand what journalled means?
basically their is no need to check an ntfs drive for errors, if the partition is corrupted or something you can use "testdisk" (sudo apt-get install testdisk) to recover the data.
oh, great let me try that
er, shit. except us.archive.ubuntu.com is down
how do I choose an alternate?
sorry
Man, now I'm getting this problem:
The following packages have unmet dependencies:
testdisk: Depends: libntfs8 (>= 1.12.1) but it is not installable
E: Broken packages
ok, then what?
let me see
nope
do you have all repos enavled?
